item.title: Liz add a quote by Liz DeJesus
item.description: "A spell perhaps?” The prince wrinkled his face as though it physically hurt him to think and ask questions." -- Liz DeJesus

item.title: Liz add a quote by Brian Clark
item.description:
"10 Steps to Becoming a Better Writer
Write. Write more. Write even more. Write even more than that. Write when you don’t want to. Write when you do. Write when you have something to say. Write when you don’t. Write every day. Keep writing." -- Brian Clark

item.title: Liz add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jill Mansell
item.description: "Last night. I couldn't put that book down. I was awake till four this morning finishing it. I didn't know reading could be like that, I had no idea." -- Jill Mansell

item.title: Liz add a quote by Jill Mansell
item.description: "Was it wrong to take a job just because you'd fallen in love with a bed?" -- Jill Mansell

item.title: Liz add a quote by J.K. Rowling
item.description: "If you want to know what a man's like, take a good look at how he treats his inferiors, not his equals." -- J.K. Rowling

item.title: Liz add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Some day you will be old enough to start reading fairy tales again." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Liz add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "Not knowing when the dawn will come I open every door." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Liz add a quote by John Milton
item.description: "For books are not absolutely dead things, but do contain a potency of life in them to be as active as that soul was whose progeny they are; nay, they do preserve as in a vial the purest efficacy and extraction of that living intellect that bred them." -- John Milton

item.title: Liz add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: Liz add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Liz add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "A self is not something static, tied up in a pretty parcel and handed to the child, finished and complete. A self is always becoming." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Liz add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Liz add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Liz add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Liz add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Liz add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Liz add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Liz add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Liz add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Liz add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "A day without sunshine is like, you know, night." -- Steve Martin

item.title: Liz add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Easy reading is damn hard writing." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Liz add a quote by Richard Castle
item.description: "There are two kinds of folks who sit around thinking about how to kill people: psychopaths and mystery writers." -- Richard Castle

item.title: Liz add a quote by Kelly Moran
item.description: "I can take two people, throw a world of obstacles at them, defy the odds, and still give them a happily-ever-after. Together. I am a romance author. What's your superpower?" -- Kelly Moran

item.title: Liz add a quote by Isaac Marion
item.description: "I want to change my punctuation. I long for exclamation marks, but I'm drowning in ellipses." -- Isaac Marion

item.title: Liz add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "Reality is that which, when you stop believing in it, doesn't go away." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Liz add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "Those who dream by day are cognizant of many things which escape those who dream only by night." -- Edgar Allan Poe
